channel.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
channel.description:
Okay.. i have a few problems.
WIFI:
Whenever i turn on my xbox i have to manually connect to my network by entering the network password... is there a way for my xbox to remember the password so it automaticly connects?
"Windows Media Center"
When ever i try to connect my console to my pc it gets to "Configuring console" and them comes up with an error and stops?"

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Some team posted proof onto youtube that the new xbox can be flashed but they haven’t released the hack yet.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:21, topic:362368”]I never thought Microsoft made the consoles overheat intentionally, just that they are a shitty company with no quality control (I mean, look at Windows :P)

Anyway, can you still flash the drive to play backups on them?[/quote]

I’m not sure about flashing the drive, I’d guess it is still possible. But there were loads of reports, leaked memos and such to the engineering team at the Xbox division within Microsoft a month or so before launch with test reports showing up that the consoles were failing, but because of the importance they put on beating Sony to market, they had to rush it out.

If those were faked or not, I don’t know, but there has been books and articles written on it by those who have considerable knowledge of the xbox division and the development of the console.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie

Mine is literally on from about 11pm to 6am every night since i got it… doesnt even feel hot. Obviously feels warm but not hot.

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“nohope, post:17, topic:362368”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=458658.msg3364891#msg3364891 date=1286686792]
People actually buy the xbox brand hard drives?
[/quote]
Why wouldnt they?[/quote]

I assume he means that, for what is just a regular hard drive with Microsoft’s proprietary connector, they’re extremely overpriced.

With the new one though, they’ve got rid of the connector. You can clearly see all the SATA connections and they are what are directly interfacing with the console, no other connectors inbetween. They’ve put the drives in a certain case though, so it still isn’t as simple as buying a regular 2.5" SATA HDD and sticking it in there.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:362368”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=458658.msg3364066#msg3364066 date=1286644076]

Whilst the new xbox 360 is being discussed, what advantages do they have over the regular 360?

I have both the old and the new. The new one has built in 802.11n wifi, a much quieter DVD drive, it is smaller, looks better, 5 USB ports, one of them used for Kinect so you don’t need an extra power adapter, whereas if you use Kinect on the old 360s, you need that power adapter.

Other than that, there isn’t really anything else. Overall, it runs much quieter and seemingly has a much better heat extraction design.
[/quote]

Do they overheat and die like the originals? And can you still flash the drive to play backups and such? Also, I’m going to have to google Kinect.[/quote]

Well, they seemed to have sorted the problem in the later models anyway of the original. There were other poorly built things on the console still, but the RROD seemed to die off over the last two year or two. It is too early to say if these have the same problem, but given how much it cost Microsoft to sort all those broken 360’s, I’d guess they wouldn’t send a new one out with such a big problem again, not intentionally anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:10, topic:362368”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=458658.msg3363964#msg3363964 date=1286636859]
Whilst the new xbox 360 is being discussed, what advantages do they have over the regular 360?
[/quote]

I have both the old and the new. The new one has built in 802.11n wifi, a much quieter DVD drive, it is smaller, looks better, 5 USB ports, one of them used for Kinect so you don’t need an extra power adapter, whereas if you use Kinect on the old 360s, you need that power adapter.

Other than that, there isn’t really anything else. Overall, it runs much quieter and seemingly has a much better heat extraction design.[/quote]

Do they overheat and die like the originals? And can you still flash the drive to play backups and such? Also, I’m going to have to google Kinect.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Nah, that was the 250GB one. That size was first introduced with the Modern warfare 2 special edition, they didn’t release the separate 250GB drive till a month or so before the introduction of the new 360.

Yeah, but you can get 250GB hard drive for the old 360, too.

PLEASE NOTE - THIS IS FOR THE HARD DRIVE ONLY, AND DOES NOT INCLUDE THE TRANSFER CABLE OR OTHER ACCESSORIES.

item.title: New Xbox 360 questions?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Whilst the new xbox 360 is being discussed, what advantages do they have over the regular 360?

I have both the old and the new. The new one has built in 802.11n wifi, a much quieter DVD drive, it is smaller, looks better, 5 USB ports, one of them used for Kinect so you don’t need an extra power adapter, whereas if you use Kinect on the old 360s, you need that power adapter.

Other than that, there isn’t really anything else. Overall, it runs much quieter and seemingly has a much better heat extraction design.

Read full topic
